alert.note: Alert for Cape Girardeau; Perry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 12:33AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Union, Jackson, southeastern Perry and central Cape Girardeau Counties through 100 AM CST... At 1232 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Altenburg to 7 miles north of Jackson to near Gordonville. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Murphysboro and Grand Tower around 1245 AM CST. Carbondale, De Soto and Ware around 1250 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Jonesboro, Elkville, Hurst, Cedar Lake Area, Anna and Cobden. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 99 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Missouri.
